titles.title: Forty-in-Four Act
Forty Percent Funding of IDEA in Four Years Act
To amend the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act to provide full funding for assistance for education of all children with disabilities.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Education Reform.

committee.name: House Committee on Education and the Workforce

bill.summary: 7/24/2001--Introduced. Forty Percent Funding of IDEA in Four Years Act - Forty-in-Four Act - Amends the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) to require specified minimum levels of Federal grant payments to States for assistance for education of all children with disabilities in order to increase funding under the Act, by five percent increments per fiscal year, from 20 percent of the national current average for per pupil expenditure in FY 2002 to 40 percent in FY 2005 and afterwards.
